revision.text: Spring Boot is a framework for building Java-based applications. It provides pre-configured templates for microservices and monolithic systems.
MySQL is an open-source relational database management system. It is used for data storage and retrieval in web applications.
REST stands for Representational State Transfer. It is an architectural style for designing networked applications using stateless protocols like HTTP.
Kubernetes is an open-source platform for automating deployment, scaling, and operations of application containers.
OAuth 2.0 is a standard for token-based authorization, widely used for securing API access in modern applications.
